results.title: Hardening and tempering carbon steel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Metalwork”.
Explains the reasons for and the processes involved in the hardening and tempering of three typical tools manufactured from hard carbon steel: a scraper, a cold chisel, and a screwdriver.

results.title: Manufacture of carbon steel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Metalwork”.
Opens with an explanation of the differences between high carbon, medium carbon, and mild steels. The main part of the film describes various stages in the manufacture of steel.

results.title: Hard soldering
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Metalwork”.
The three forms in which spelter is available; wire, strip and grain. Brazing the joints on a toasting fork. Uses of borax flux, wet and dry. Close-up shots of the brazing hearth. The heating up technique. Quenching, pickling, and cleaning up. Jointing two pipes into a T-piece. Wiring them into position. Seaming the joint on a square pipe.

results.title: Between the hammer and the anvil
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Metalwork”.
This film describes the entire process of forging metal, emphasising the importance of a clean forge to obtain clean forgings. Describes the preparation of the fire; the structure of the anvil; the use of tongs. Illustrates the following fundamental processes: drawing down; upsetting; the making of bends; the eye and change of section. Also describes intricate operations for decorative iron-work, including the scroll in all of which the various forms of hammer serve as the principal tools. Concludes with a fine example of workmanship - a wrought-iron gate. No other credits available.

results.title: The Milling machine
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education and DCA Educational Products
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Machines”.
Didactic film illustrating the various parts of the vertical and horizontal milling machines. Shows nomenclature of vertical and horizontal milling machines; similarities and differences of vertical and horizontal milling machines; and use of the power feed. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The World of animals: insects in a garden
results.creator_credit: William Kay and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
Uses time lapse and photomicrography to study various insects on a rose bush - aphids, ants, lacewings, and ladybird beetles. Illustrates states in the life cycle of insects; complete metamorphosis in the lacewing and ladybird beetle and incomplete metamorphosis in the aphid. Shows close-up views of ants protecting aphids from ladybird beetles.

results.title: Your sleep and rest
results.creator_credit: David Bennett and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
Emphasises the need for body cells to replenish their energy and building materials and to eliminate wastes which accumulate. Shows the part played by the circulatory system in this process. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
